keyMoments.title: Brook Found with Amnesia
keyMoments.description: Brook is pulled from a river by Usopp, suffering from complete amnesia and only remembering his name. He discovers a flute hidden in his skull.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces Brook's alternate universe character and sets up the mystery of his past with the Thriller Company.

keyMoments.title: Brook Remembers His Betrayal
keyMoments.description: Brook regains his memories and reveals he was once part of the Thriller Company before attempting to leave. Hogback, Perona, and Absalom threw him in the river as punishment.
keyMoments.significance: Provides Brook's backstory in this alternate universe and establishes his motivation to help defeat the Thriller Company.

abilities.description: Brook stores and plays a flute kept inside his skull.

relationships.description: Former ally who betrayed Brook by throwing him in the river when he tried to leave the Thriller Company.

evolutionMoments.description: Brook remembers Hogback's betrayal and seeks revenge.

relationships.description: Brook joins Boss Luffy's crew to help defeat the Thriller Company.

evolutionMoments.description: Brook becomes an ally of Boss Luffy after being rescued from the river.

reveals.information: Was a member of the Thriller Company before being betrayed and left in the river

keyMoments.title: Franky Recruited as Mikoshi Builder
keyMoments.description: Boss Luffy recruits Franky, known as the greatest builder in Grand Jipangu, to construct their mikoshi for the race.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Franky's role as a master craftsman in this alternate universe and his commitment to helping the crew.
keyMoments.quote: I'll build you a mikoshi good enough to beat the Thriller Company!

abilities.description: Renowned as the greatest builder in Grand Jipangu, capable of constructing superior mikoshi.

relationships.description: Accepts Boss Luffy's commission to build their racing mikoshi.

evolutionMoments.description: Franky agrees to build a mikoshi for Boss Luffy's team.

name.english: Monkey D. Luffy / Boss Luffy (Alternate Universe)
name.japanese: モンキー・D・ルフィ / ルフィ親分

keyMoments.title: Boss Luffy Enters Mikoshi Race
keyMoments.description: Boss Luffy decides to enter the mikoshi race with his crew from the Pinwheel Eatery to compete for the 1,000,000 belly prize.
keyMoments.significance: Sets up the main plot and establishes Boss Luffy's determination to compete despite the challenges.

keyMoments.title: Refuses to Give Up Despite Sabotage
keyMoments.description: After discovering their mikoshi has been destroyed by the Thriller Company, Boss Luffy refuses to quit and commits to rebuilding for the race.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Boss Luffy's core character trait of never giving up, mirroring the main universe Luffy's determination.

keyMoments.title: Perona Uses Negative Hollows
keyMoments.description: Perona uses her Negative Hollows to demotivate the Flying Fish Riders team, causing their leader Duval to destroy their own mikoshi in self-loathing.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates that devil fruit powers exist and function in this alternate universe setting, showing the Thriller Company's supernatural advantage.

abilities.description: Creates ghost-like hollows that drain the target's willpower and make them extremely negative and self-deprecating.

relationships.description: Participated in betraying Brook and throwing him in the river when he tried to leave the Thriller Company.

keyMoments.title: Absalom Uses Invisibility Powers
keyMoments.description: Absalom uses his Clear-Clear Fruit powers to make the Thriller Company invisible while they sabotage the Rolling Express team's mikoshi.
keyMoments.significance: Shows another devil fruit ability functioning in the alternate universe and demonstrates the Thriller Company's unfair advantage through supernatural powers.

abilities.description: Can make himself and others invisible using the Clear-Clear Fruit powers.

relationships.description: Participated in betraying Brook and throwing him in the river when he tried to leave the Thriller Company.

keyMoments.title: Hogback's Betrayal of Brook
keyMoments.description: It is revealed that Hogback, along with Perona and Absalom, betrayed Brook by throwing him in the river when he attempted to leave the Thriller Company.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes Hogback as one of the primary antagonists and gives Brook personal motivation for revenge.

relationships.description: Led the betrayal of Brook, throwing him in the river as punishment for trying to leave.

keyMoments.title: Duval's Team Sabotaged
keyMoments.description: As leader of the Legendary Flying Fish Riders team, Duval falls victim to Perona's Negative Hollows and destroys his own team's mikoshi while in a state of extreme self-loathing.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates the effectiveness of the Thriller Company's sabotage tactics and shows a competing team being eliminated from the race.
